greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = (a(n-1)*a(n-3) - a(n-2)^2) / a(n-4), with a(0) = 0, a(1) = a(2) = a(3) = 1, a(4) = -1.
comment: a(n+1) is (-1)^binomial(n,2) times the Hankel transform of the sequence with g.f.
-1,1,2,-3/4,-2/9,21,... are the x-coordinates of the multiples of z=(0,0) on the elliptic curve E: y^2 - 2xy - y = x^3-x. (End)
This is a strong elliptic divisibility sequence t_n as given in [Kimberling, p. 16] where x = 1, y = 1, z = -1.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..250
Paul Barry, Jacobsthal Decompositions of Pascal's Triangle, Ternary Trees, and Alternating Sign Matrices, Journal of Integer Sequences, 19, 2016, #16.3.5.
Paul Barry, Riordan Pseudo-Involutions, Continued Fractions and Somos 4 Sequences, arXiv:1807.05794 [math.CO], 2018.
Clark Kimberling, Strong divisibility sequences and some conjectures, Fib. Quart., 17 (1979), 13-17.
formula: a(2*n + 1) = a(n + 2) * a(n)^3 - a(n - 1) * a(n + 1)^3 for all n in Z.
a(2*n) = a(n + 2) * a(n) * a(n - 1)^2 - a(n) * a(n - 2) * a(n + 1)^2 for all n in Z.
0 = a(n)*a(n+5) - a(n+1)*a(n+4) - a(n+2)*a(n+3) for all n in Z. - _Michael Somos_, Jul 07 2014
0 = a(n)*a(n+6) + a(n+1)*a(n+5) - 2*a(n+2)*a(n+4) for all n in Z. - _Michael Somos_, Jul 07 2014
maple: P:= proc(n) option remember; if n < 4 then 1 else if n=4 then -1 else
fi; fi; end: seq(P(n), n=0..30); # _Paolo P. Lava_, Sep 27 2018, after _Robert Israel_ at A018896
program: (PARI) an=vector(200); for(n=1,4,an[ n ]=[ 1,1,1,-1 ][ n ]); for(n=5, length(an),an[ n ]=(an[ n-1 ]*an[ n-3 ]-an[ n-2 ]^2)/an[ n-4 ]); a(n) =sign(n)*an[ abs(n)+(n==0) ]

(PARI) {a(n) = my(an); if( n<0, -a(-n), if( n==0, 0, an = vector( max(4, n), i, 1); an[4] = -1; for( k=5, n, an[k] = (an[k-1] * an[k-3] - an[k-2]^2) / an[k-4]); an[n]))}; /* _Michael Somos_, Jul 07 2014 */
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Dec 28 1999
